ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] What's better?
ygData.msgSnippet: Probably the best item for a half-elf or wood-elf bard would be the Enchanted Koada-Dal Mithril Plate collar.  It has AC 9, and +3 STR and +4 Cha.  Might be
ygData.messageBody:
Probably the best item for a half-elf or wood-elf bard would be the
Enchanted Koada-Dal Mithril Plate collar. It has AC 9, and +3 STR and +4
Cha. Might be tough finding a smith who makes it depending on your server.

-----Original Message-----
From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@...]
Sent: Monday, June 25, 2001 4:58 PM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] What's better?



Have to agree -- until you start a serious charming career, go with
strength. It is probably most important at lower lvls too because you wear
heavier armor then.
Stephen McCloskey <s.mccloskey@...> wrote: imho at level 11 it
doesn't matter much. If you need more STR then go with
that, else use the CHA. At 11 I was always looking for STR as I was
wearing all bronze and heavy weapons. I didn't start trading in my STR for
CHA until I was getting lighter gear.

-Steve

>Just got my lvl 11 bard a silver cats eye necklace insanely cheap (a few
>cats eye agates and 3pp for it), then realized I already had a 3str item
>in that slot... So what's better, 3 str or 3 cha?
>
>
>--
>~Umi-chan
